channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CO
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for CO

item.title: Report X-2023120319
item.description:
Report X-2023120319

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-21T18:11:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-02
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Leaking package discovered during sortation. Package placed in lined hazmat tote and sent to QA. DescribePack: Plastic jugs in heat-sealed plastic bags inside corrugated carton with corrugated stabilizer/divider insert. Loose cap came off one jug and allowed spillage which damaged carton. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package placed in lined hazmat tote and sent to QA.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Qa was called to unload and pkg. was on ground leaking out and QA put inside a lined tote and took to hazmat cage. DescribePack: plastic gallon was cracked and all the liquid leaked out soiling outer carton and inner bottles. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: Pkg. was placed inside a linded tote and was taken to hazmat cage to get inspected.

DescribePack: Closure came loose which caused the liquid to leak out. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: Pkg. was placed inside a lined tote and placed in hazmat cage to get inspected.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was discovered wet after receiving an IC scan. As soon as it was discovered wet, it was placed into a damage tote complete with liner, orientation arrows being followed. DescribePack: Contents that leaked had lids that were about a half turn loose. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed into damage tote complete with liner. Orientation arrows were observed. Leak was contained to packaging.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was discovered in the unload. The unload manager called out for an Admin's assistance over the radio. DescribePack: Three of the four bottles had loose lids which led to the leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The Admin contained the damaged hazmat in a hazardous material spill tote then transported the shipment to the hazmat cage for processing.

Loos caps on two jerricans allowed leakage which damaged adhesives of tape and labels and soiled carton. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package placed in lined hazmat tote and sent to QA.

item.title: Report E-2023120084
item.description:
Report E-2023120084

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-14T21:11:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-28
  • City: AURORA
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 28, 2023, two (2) 330-gallon totes of UN3266 were damaged in transit by over-stacked freight and released approximately four (4) cups of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Hazmat Services (EHS) to remediate the impacted site. The crew deployed decontaminate and absorbent pads to the release and containerized the impacted pads in one (1) 5-gallon bucket for disposal. The two (2) damaged totes were transferred into a new set of drums for further processing.

item.title: Report E-2023120039
item.description:
Report E-2023120039

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-14T21:11:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-09
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 9, 2023 a trailer in temporary storage at Veolia's 10 day intransit facility in Henderson Colorado was observed to be smoking. The dock area was immediately evacuated and the Veolia emergency response team evaluated the situation. Further investigation revealed a 55 gallon drum containing inner containers of hydrochloric acid and alkyl sulfonic acid was improperly packed. The container of sulfonic acid shifted and fell on its side during transportation resulting in a release of material which mixed with the hydrochloric acid causing a reaction and vapor release. The Veolia ER team repacked the material into two separate containers - one containing the hydrochloric acid and one containing only the alkyl sulfonic acid. The alkyl sulfonic acid drum was reloaded on the rear of the vehicle for continued transportation to the disposal facility.
